thread.title: Oculus takes aim at mainstream with inexpensive gear, video
thread.title_full: Oculus takes aim at mainstream with inexpensive gear, video - Yahoo Finance

author: Ryan Nakashima, AP Business Writer
title: Oculus takes aim at mainstream with inexpensive gear, video
text:
. View photo
A 3D plastic representation of the Facebook logo is seen in this illustration in Zenica, Bosnia and Herzegovina, May 13, 2015. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic 

LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Virtual reality is taking a few steps closer to the mainstream with Samsung unveiling a headset that brings the technology to its latest smartphones at half the price of its previous model, Facebook launching support for 360-degree video, and online video services like Netflix and Hulu jumping into the format.
The series of announcements at a developers conference for virtual reality technology company Oculus in Los Angeles represents attempts to push the platform beyond a video-gamer-focused niche.
Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg, who cut a deal to buy Oculus for $2 billion last year, told some 1,500 conference attendees that virtual reality was "the next logical step" in online sharing after text, photos and video.
Facebook Virtual reality
